intro: Diplotaxis catholica subvar. rivulorum, commonly known as the river dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. The species is noted for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
